mdRecord.dcterms:title: Riverside Township Hall, exterior
City Hall
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Ashby, George W. (American architect, 1860-1933) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: City Hall serves as the governmental offices of the Village of Riverside and Riverside Township. Representative of Chateauesque Style of architecture with its massive and irregular form, steeply pitched, hipped roof with copper ridges and decorative finials, mixture of rusticated limestone and brick materials with decorative stone banding employed across the second floor at the level of the lintels, parapeted wall dormers rising through the cornice line to feature tall, narrow, double-hung windows with multiple panes, and towers at the corners of the building. -- http://www.riverside-illinois.com/History.htm [work]
